title: UNHRC
description: The Human Rights Council is an intergovernmental body within the United Nations system made up of 47 States responsible for the promotion and protection of all human rights around the globe. The Human Rights Council makes sure that all people understand their rights, have the same rights, can use their rights. It helps with people whose rights had been taken away. Currently, there are 47 member countries in HRC. The Human Rights Council also works with the UN Special Procedures established by the former Commission on Human Rights (which was replaced by UNHRC in 2006) and now assumed by the Council.
